articles.author: Erin Banco, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The U.S. decision to allow Ukraine to fire American weapons deeper into Russia has not increased the risk of a nuclear attack, which is unlikely, despite Russian President Vladimir Putin's increasingly bellicose statements, five sources familiar with U.S. intelligence told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nuclear attack unlikely despite Putin's warnings, US intelligence says

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: With the bodies of its fighters still strewn on the battlefield, Hezbollah must bury its dead and provide succour to its supporters who bore the brunt of Israel's offensive, as the first steps on a long and costly road to recovery, four senior officials said.
articles.title: Still counting its dead, Hezbollah faces long road to recover from war

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's administration is preparing a $725 million weapons package for Ukraine, two U.S. officials said on Wednesday, as the outgoing president seeks to bolster the government in Kyiv before leaving office in January.
articles.title: Exclusive: Biden readies $725 million arms aid package for Ukraine, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's military held an early morning air defence drill on Thursday to test its response and engagement procedures, ahead of a trip by President Lai Ching-te at the end of the week to the Pacific that will include U.S. stopovers.
articles.title: Taiwan holds air defence drill ahead of president's Pacific trip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 37,000 people have been affected by flooding caused by torrential rain in six Malaysian states this week, Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Thursday.
articles.title: Malaysia PM says tens of thousands of people in six states hit by flooding

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea grappled with heavy snowfall for a second day on Thursday, with dozens of flights cancelled, ferry operations suspended and at least four people reported dead in a bitter winter, though conditions showed signs of easing.
articles.title: South Korea battles second day of heavy snow; four dead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Human rights activists accused Vietnam of infringing freedom of religion after a court handed jail sentences this week to six ethnically Khmer Buddhist monks and three religious activists.
articles.title: Rights group says Vietnam's jailing of Khmer monks violated religious freedom

articles.author: David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Russia's deputy U.N. ambassador said on Wednesday any decision by President-elect Donald Trump's incoming administration to cut support for Ukraine would be a "death sentence" for the Ukrainian army, while accusing Kyiv of trying to drag NATO countries into direct conflict with Russia in the meantime.
articles.title: Russia says Trump Ukraine aid cut would be 'death sentence' for Kyiv's military

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel will gradually withdraw its forces over 60 days as Lebanon's army takes control of territory near its border with Israel to ensure that Hezbollah does not rebuild its infrastructure there.
articles.title: Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire, brokered by US and France, aims for permanent peace

articles.author: Shivam Patel
articles.description: Gunmen seized six hostages this month while exchanging fire with troops in India's northeastern state of Manipur after a rocket-propelled grenade reduced vehicles and homes to charred hulks in the hilly district of Jiribam.
articles.title: Ethnic strife frustrates peace efforts in India's Manipur
